citations.narrative:
There were fifteen adult dogs on the animal inventory that did not have microchips. There was no other form of official tag
attached to these animals.
All dogs, including puppies, must have distinctive identification so that animals can be identified in the case of an animal
disease outbreak, and to identify specific animals that may require routine or veterinary care.
A class “A” breeder shall identify all dogs under his control or on his premises, whether held, purchased, or otherwise
acquired. All dogs and puppies held at the facility must have a distinctive identification.
Correction Date: October 31, 2023

One adult male poodle "Evan" was houses in an outdoor run with no access to the indoor part of the building. He had
domed shade shelter the was open on both ends. He did not have shelter from the elements. He was not provided with
additional bedding and the low temperature last night was 41 °F.
The welfare of dogs can be adversely effected by cold temperatures and when inadequate shelter is provided.
Shelters in outdoor facilities for dogs must contain a roof, four sides, and a floor, and must contain clean, dry, bedding
material if the ambient temperature is below 50 °F (10 °C).
Correction Date: October 18, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(b)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
There were fifteen adult dogs on the animal inventory that did not have microchips. There was no other form of official tag 
attached to these animals.  
All dogs, including puppies, must have distinctive identification so that animals can be identified in the case of an animal 
disease outbreak, and to identify specific animals that may require routine or veterinary care.  
A class “A” breeder shall identify all dogs under his control or on his premises, whether held, purchased, or otherwise 
acquired. All dogs and puppies held at the facility must have a distinctive identification.  
Correction Date: October 31, 2023 
3.4(b) 
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
One adult male poodle "Evan" was houses in an outdoor run with no access to the indoor part of the building. He had 
domed shade shelter the was open on both ends. He did not have shelter from the elements. He was not provided with 
additional bedding and the low temperature last night was 41 °F. 
The welfare of dogs can be adversely effected by cold temperatures and when inadequate shelter is provided.  
Shelters in outdoor facilities for dogs must contain a roof, four sides, and a floor, and must contain clean, dry, bedding 
material if the ambient temperature is below 50 °F (10 °C). 
Correction Date: October 18, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
